value.0: This book contains alot of information about various dragons.

A bronze dragon hatchling's scales are yellow tinged with green, showing only a hint of bronze. But as it grows its color deepens slowly into a darker, richer bronze tone. Very old dragon's gains a blueblack tint to the edges of their scales.

Bronze dragons are powerful swimmers they got webbed feet and smooth flat scales.

Its eyes fades to green orbs as it ages.

Newly hatched copper dragon's scales have a ruddy brown color which a metallic tint. As it gets older the scales become finner and more coppery assuming a soft, warm gloss when it reaches adulthood.

Very old dragon's scales begins to gain a green tint to them and its pupils fades and the eyes of its oldest resembles glowing turquouse orbs.

A hatchling Brass dragon's scales are dull, mottled brown and as the dragon ages the scales become more brassy eventaully it reaches a warm burnished appearance.

It also sports bladed chin horns which grows sharper as they age its wings are frills are mottled green which darkens as it ages.

Its eyes fades as it gains age until they resemble molten metal orbs.

Brass dragons dwells in warm deserts

A newly hatched Gold dragon's scales are dark yellow with golden metallic flecks.

These flecks grows as the dragon matures untill reaching adulthood the scales are completely golden.

A Gold dragon's face is bewhiskered and their pupils glow and slowly fade untill they resemble pools of molten gold.

Gold dragons dwells on warm plains.

At young age a silver dragon are blue grayish with sliver highlights and as they age the scales brighten into clear sliver and become scarcely visible.

Sliverdragons usually dwell on temperate mountains.

Black dragons, also known as the Skull dragons because of their skeletal faces. The skeletal decoration of the hide around the base of the horn and the cheekbones grows as the dragon gains age, this doesnt hurt the dragon.

Hatchling Black dragons's scales are think, small and glossy. As the dragon becomes older they thinken and become duller helping it camouflage itself in the swamps and marshes.

Black dragons are awefully fond of coin and will kill to increase their hoards.

The scales on a hatchling White dragon glisten like mirrors but which age the sheen disappears.

Really old white dragon's scales are pale blue and light gray mixed with white.

Newly hatched Green dragon tend to be darkish green and in the shade of the forest they appear almost black, the unknowing might mistake them for black dragon offspring.

Their scales grow larger, lighter and the color turns from darkgreen to shades of forest, emerald and olive green as they grow, which helps them blends in with its wooden surroundings as it dwells in the forest.

Blue dragons usually dwells in deserts. There scales vary in color from azure to indigo, polished glossy by the blowing sands of the desert.

The size of its sacles increases little as the dragon ages, but , they do grow thinker and harder. A Blue dragon constantly crackles with static elecricity which increases or decreases with its mood.

Blue dragons are easily spotted in the dusty desert and thereby tends to borrow into the sands so only part of their heads are exposed.

However Blue dragons enjoys soaring in the desert air at day time which gives it a good cammoflage against the clear desert sky.

Blue dragons tend to store their treasure in caves, they collect anything that looks valuable, they especially likes gems and foremost sapphires.

Young red dragons usually stay underground or in caves untill they've grown older due to the bright glossy scarlet they're easily spotted.

Older red dragons tend to have deep red dullish scales, the scales also grow thicker as it ages and its scales are as strong as metal.

Its wings are ash blue or purple-gray towards the edges which darkens as it ages.

The red dragons eyes glows red but it fades as it ages and start to resemble molten lava orbs.
